creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
When viewing a previous revision, the user is presented with the correct menu
entries as though they were viewing the current authoring page. This is
confusing as the Submit option may be available, or they may try to edit the
page. All the menu entries operate on the current authoring page. The only
indication they are viewing a revision is the URL. This isn't enough difference.
A previous version of the trunk threw an exception when trying to publish a
revision. I know this because I saw a very experienced user make the mistake.
This has been fixed, but it does show that something different needs to be done
to indicate it is a previous revision and can only be viewed.

Maybe getting rid of the menu entirely would work.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
The menubar is now hidden when viewing a revision.
Thanks for reporting!
